intro: Actinolema macrolema, commonly known as the broadleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals surrounding a yellow center, and it has hairy, narrow leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Actinolema macrolema is known for its resilience and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
